title: Left click stopped working
body: Somehow in the middle of a game my left mouse button stopped working (can't move with it) and the right mouse button is now moving my character. In the settings I see MB2 for movement and I can't change it back. I deleted the config folder and started and exitted a custom game as per RIOT advice elsewhere but that didn't work. Anyone can help?

replies.body:
God, how cumbersome. I managed to fix it by following the advice of another player. These were the steps:

1) Login
2) Delete your Config folder (this includes PersistedSettings.json and input.ini)
3) Go into a custom game (you should now have default settings)
4) Change left click attack to some random button to create input file (I.e N)
5) Ext game
6) Edit input file:

[GameEvents]
evtPlayerMoveClick=[Button 1]

((Include two blank lines for spacing from the top and none on the bottom.))

7) Save the input.ini file.
8) Log in to the problem account
9) Start a custom game for testing
10) When the game is running and you're in game, delete the PersistedSettings file
11) Log out and Ext game
12) Log back in ((The client should now automatically reload the PersistedSettings file with the same info as your input.ini file to reflect your proper mouse keybindings.
I somehow get the feeling I mixed up my keybindings in my head from playing Diablo 3 too much lately. Is right click supposed to be default for moving?
Movement has always been with right-clicking for me.

Yea... I thought as much. Somehow playing a few weeks of Diablo 3 and going back to LoL confused me. Hah!

Thanks for the response.

Since we've already tried resetting your config folder to reset your keybinds back to default, let's try a different approach. If you have other programs running in the background (like Steam or perhaps Razor Synapse for your keyboard/mouse) they can interact with League in funny ways, such as controlling what keybinds are being used.

Follow [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq7) to do a clean boot to make sure that no other programs are interfering with League.
